1) The extended complex plane (Riemann sphere)
- The Riemann sphere is C ∪ {∞}, a compactification of the complex plane obtained by adding a single “point at infinity.” The map z ↦ 1/z is a bijection of the Riemann sphere that sends 0 to ∞ and ∞ to 0. In that context the identity 1/0 = ∞ is standard and precise: the reciprocal map is extended so that 0’s reciprocal is the added point ∞.

  - lim_{x→0+} 1/x = +∞
  - lim_{x→0-} 1/x = −∞
